subject: History
title: Blitzkrieg: Lightning War
description: A short lesson to help you apply Blitzkrieg: Lightning War.

hook.text: Germany conquered France in six weeks. The country that bled for four years in WWI fell before summer ended.

buildup.text: Blitzkrieg combined tanks, dive bombers, and fast-moving infantry to punch through enemy lines before they could react.

discovery.text: In May 1940, Germany attacked through the Ardennes forestâ€”terrain the French thought was impassable for tanks.

twist.text: The French army was larger. Their Maginot Line was unbreakable. Germany simply went around it.

climax.text: Paris fell on June 14. France surrendered on June 22. The shock was felt around the world.

punchline.text: Speed beat strengthâ€”and rewrote military history.

quiz.question: How did Germany defeat France so quickly in 1940?
options: By bombing Paris until France surrendered
By attacking through the Ardennes, bypassing the Maginot Line with fast-moving forces
By using chemical weapons on the French front lines
